Detailed Description

This class is taken from INET FrameWork switches and changed a bit to support logical links.

The basic struct used here is the mac_llid which bonds a MAC address with a logical entity. The same struct could be used to support VLANs in the switches.

From the INET documentation:

"Implements base switching functionality of Ethernet switches. Note that neither activity() nor handleMessage() is redefined here -- active behavior (incl. queueing and performance aspects) must be addressed in subclasses."

Member Typedef Documentation

The mac-address table as a map of mac_llid and extra information.

void MACVlanRelayUnitBase::readAddressTable ( const char *  fileName  )  [protected, virtual]

Pre-reads in entries for Address Table during initialization. 

00234 {
00235     FILE *fp = fopen(fileName, "r");
00236     if (fp == NULL)
00237         error("cannot open address table file `%s'", fileName);
00238 
00239     //  Syntax of the file goes as:
00240     //  Address in hexadecimal representation, portName
00241     //  ffffffff    Xout        1000
00242     //  ffffeed1    Yout        901
00243     //  aabcdeff    Zout        3
00244     //
00245     //  etc...
00246     //
00247     //  Each iteration of the loop reads in an entire line i.e. up to '\n' or EOF characters
00248     //  and uses strtok to extract tokens from the resulting string
00249     char *line;
00250     int lineno = 0;
00251     while ((line = fgetline(fp)) != NULL)
00252     {
00253         lineno++;
00254 
00255         // lines beginning with '#' are treated as comments
00256         if (line[0]=='#')
00257             continue;
00258 
00259         // scan in hexaddress
00260         char *hexaddress = strtok(line, " \t");
00261         // scan in port number
00262         string portName;
00263         portName = strtok(NULL, " \t");
00264         // scan in logical number
00265         char *llid = strtok(NULL, " \t");
00266 
00267         // empty line?
00268         if (!hexaddress)
00269             continue;
00270 
00271         // broken line?
00272         if (portName!="" || !llid)
00273             error("line %d invalid in address table file `%s'", lineno, fileName);
00274 
00275 
00276         // Create an entry with address and portName and insert into table
00277         AddressEntry entry;
00278         entry.insertionTime = 0;
00279         entry.portName = portName;
00280         mac_llid ml;
00281         ml.mac=MACAddress(hexaddress);
00282         ml.llid = atoi(llid);
00283         addresstable[ml] = entry;
00284 
00285         // Garbage collection before next iteration
00286         delete [] line;
00287     }
00288     fclose(fp);
00289 }

void MACVlanRelayUnitBase::removeAgedEntriesFromTable (  )  [protected, virtual]

Utility function: throws out all aged entries from table. 

00103 {
00104     for (AddressTable::iterator iter = addresstable.begin(); iter != addresstable.end();)
00105     {
00106         AddressTable::iterator cur = iter++; // iter will get invalidated after erase()
00107         AddressEntry& entry = cur->second;
00108         if (entry.insertionTime + agingTime <= simTime())
00109         {
00110             EV << "Removing aged entry from Address Table: " <<
00111                   cur->first << " --> port" << cur->second.portName << "\n";
00112             addresstable.erase(cur);
00113         }
00114     }
00115 }

void MACVlanRelayUnitBase::removeOldestTableEntry (  )  [protected, virtual]

Utility function: throws out oldest (not necessarily aged) entry from table. 

00118 {
00119     AddressTable::iterator oldest = addresstable.end();
00120     simtime_t oldestInsertTime = simTime()+1;
00121     for (AddressTable::iterator iter = addresstable.begin(); iter != addresstable.end(); iter++)
00122     {
00123         if (iter->second.insertionTime < oldestInsertTime)
00124         {
00125             oldest = iter;
00126             oldestInsertTime = iter->second.insertionTime;
00127         }
00128     }
00129     if (oldest != addresstable.end())
00130     {
00131         EV << "Table full, removing oldest entry: " <<
00132               oldest->first << " --> port" << oldest->second.portName <<"\n";
00133         addresstable.erase(oldest);
00134     }
00135 }

void MACVlanRelayUnitBase::updateTableWithAddress ( mac_llid  MacLLid,
std::string  portName 
) [protected, virtual]

Enters address into table. 

00147 {
00148     AddressTable::iterator iter;
00149 
00150     iter = addresstable.find(MacLLid);
00151     if (iter == addresstable.end())
00152     {
00153         // Observe finite table size
00154         if (addressTableSize!=0 && addresstable.size() == (unsigned int)addressTableSize)
00155         {
00156             // lazy removal of aged entries: only if table gets full (this step is not strictly needed)
00157             EV << "Making room in Address Table by throwing out aged entries.\n";
00158             removeAgedEntriesFromTable();
00159 
00160             if (addresstable.size() == (unsigned int)addressTableSize)
00161                 removeOldestTableEntry();
00162         }
00163 
00164         // Add entry to table
00165         EV << "Adding entry to Address Table: "<< MacLLid.mac << " --> port " << portName
00166                                 << " --> llid " << MacLLid.llid << "\n";
00167         AddressEntry entry;
00168         entry.portName = portName;
00169         entry.insertionTime = simTime();
00170         addresstable[MacLLid] = entry;
00171 
00172     }
00173     else
00174     {
00175         // Update existing entry
00176         EV << "Updating entry in Address Table: "<< MacLLid.mac << " --> port " << portName
00177                                 << " --> llid " << MacLLid.llid << "\n";
00178         AddressEntry& entry = iter->second;
00179         entry.insertionTime = simTime();
00180         entry.portName = portName;
00181     }
00182 }
